div.p: The Fall of Richmond The tidings received in the Northern Metropolis (April, 1865)

What mean these peals from every tower, And crowds like seas that sway? The cannon reply; they speak the heart Of the People impassioned, and say— A city in flags for a city in flames, Richmond goes Babylon's way— Sing and pray.

O weary years and woeful wars, And armies in the grave; But hearts unquelled at last deter The helmed dilated Lucifer— Honor to Grant the brave, Whose three stars now like OrionConstellation with three stars that forming Orion's belt.
[reference, astronomy]'s rise When wreck is on the wave— Bless his glaive.
Well that the faith we firmly kept, And never our aim forswore For the Terrors that trooped from each recess When fainting we fought in the Wilderness, And HellA place of torment, punishment, and suffering in the afterlife.
[reference, biblical] made loud hurrah; But God is in HeavenThe dwelling place of God.
[reference, biblical], and Grant in the Town, And Right through might is Law— God's way adore.
